“This bill granted exclusive powers to the ‘National Investigation Agency’ (NIA). The NIA may place any person in warning under the UAPA without the prior permission of the State Government. It is against federalism, which is guaranteed by the Constitution of India.”

“If someone is reserved under the UAPA, the burden of proofing his innocence is on them. This amendment allows the government to capture its property. So how will they pay the legal fees to prove their innocence, if they are wrongly accused?”

“This will give more police powers to the central government. It is possible to misuse the possibility of designating individuals as terrorists. “The terrorism of wolves alone is increasingly threatened. Solitary wolves terrorists have no association with terrorist organizations, but they are committing terrorist attacks alone. This new UAPA amendment is likely to stop the terrorism of wolves alone."

“To prevent human rights violations, a four-step review is added. India has not begun to designate individuals as terrorists. The United States, the European Union and China also have this provision.”

So far, only organizations were designated as terrorist organizations, but not individuals. It is necessary to act strongly against terrorism in the context of increasing threats by terrorists. It is therefore necessary to strengthen the UAPA.

"Today, India has no well-developed infrastructure to ensure data security. On the other hand, developed countries already have efficient infrastructure. So, rushing to the location of data may not be a wise step. Because in the absence of effective infrastructure, data is subject to cyber attacks. And the risk is serious here because it is financial data. But as the laws are adopted, it is very difficult to develop efficient infrastructure at a faster pace.”

“Data storage in India leads to higher operating costs for payment system operators. Because in other countries, they have cheaper alternatives. And also for cross-border transactions, they need to store the data in two places, which increases the costs. These additional costs are likely to be impacted on consumers.”

“Data localization laws lead to the establishment of several data centers locally. This will create many jobs and greatly help the country’s economy. It will also stimulate innovation on the ground, which will lead to cheap solutions.”

“All investigating crimes will need access to payment data. If the data is stored abroad, it is very difficult to obtain permission from that country to access the data. This leads to delays in the resolution of crimes. If the data is stored here in our country, this problem will be avoided.”

"India is a big consumer market for many foreign companies. Thus, India and other developing countries realize the economic value of data and the importance of data location. With the location of the data, the national companies and the economy of the country will be beneficial. And we can also ensure data security.”

“Data is considered a ‘new form of wealth’. In general, companies use data to understand consumer requirements and also to influence their behavior. New products can be developed by analysing data to meet consumer needs. The data has an economic value. In general, developed countries benefit from this opportunity thanks to their well-developed infrastructure.”

“We are in a globalized world. Today, the world works on the free movement of people, goods, services and data. Data localization laws appear to be part of protectionist policies, which constitutes a threat to the free movement of data.”

“The United States is against data localization laws. Recently at the G20 summit, U.S. President Donald Trump spoke against data localization. Its position is natural because it increases the operating costs of U.S. companies. The bilateral relations between India and the United States are important for both countries because we are linked to the export and import of IT services, professional and goods, etc. So imposing data localization laws without threatening Indo-American relations is another challenge.”
We can ensure the confidentiality of the data by locating the data.
The location of the data may result in the government’s surveillance of its citizens.
“Data localization is important for data sovereignty, which means that citizens’ data should be held by the respective governments and not by other countries.”

The law is very clear about the fact that RTI does not only deal with government bodies. It is also for non-governmental organizations that are substantially financed and controlled by the government. There are many subsidies (including tax exemptions) which are benefited by political parties and which are therefore substantially funded by the Government.
“Political parties are independent bodies, they do not have to give accounts to the public. They were not established by the Constitution or by a law of the Parliament.”

The ITR Act stipulates that wherever there is public interest, these bodies must be transparent and cover the scope of the law. Today there are a number of private organizations, whether they are partially or entirely funded; schools, hospitals, etc. which are under the Law on Access to Information and not just government organizations.”
The income tax law and the Electoral Commission contain appropriate provisions that allow people to have the information they want.

“The ITR Act contains provisions pursuant to Article 8 that mention the notion of competitive interest. Certain exemptions are provided in cases where it can be proven that the disclosure of information can harm the competitive advantage of the party. This is not only a problem with political parties, but also a large number of governmental and private bodies.”

“Political funding is the source of corruption. Citizens have the right to know where political parties collect these funds, how they spend them and on the basis of their decisions. Crony’s capitalism will be substantially blocked if the political parties are subject to the RTI law.”

“According to the IT Act, political parties do not need to disclose donations that are less than 20,000 INR. An informal study conducted in 2010 on 6 key political parties shows that they raised Rs 700 crore. 95% of the amount was increased by amounts below Rs 20,000. It is very likely that political parties will use this gap to their advantage.”
“Political parties declare certain promises in their manifests. After being elected, citizens have the right to know why the promises made by political parties have not been fulfilled.”

“Political parties are at the heart of democracy. Political parties form the government. Government policies are then governed by the party’s ideology. So it becomes essential that political parties are subject to the RTI.”

“If political parties fall under the RTI, it will affect their internal proper functioning. Rivals can use RTI to malign themselves. Moreover, as political parties are not directly connected to the public, an RTI would be invalid.”

"Al new programming languages replace the old, the basic concepts are the same for almost all programming languages. So, whoever has a degree in coding will have an advantage over the student of a non-IT training.”

“People change their careers even after working in a field for several years because our interests change. So when someone can do so while having so many personal responsibilities, it’s much easier for young people to learn a new skill.”

“The variable salary increases the productivity of employees. People with high yield feel well paid and rewarded for their efforts, while people with insufficient yield also feel motivated to improve.”

“In variable pay schemes, employees feel satisfied and motivated by their work. They believe that they are an integral part of the organization, that they recognize them as part of its growth and that they value their efforts.”

“The variable salary helps to retain valuable employees. This helps to retain good talents for long periods and consequently reduce the expenditure spent on the hiring of new talents. This ensures the stability of the organization.”

“It has been found that it is difficult to keep employees in the release period when they are subject to variable wages schemes. Workers who receive commissions do well when the business is good, but they do bad when the business is bad. In the slowing period of business, even the best sellers might have difficulty making enough sales to earn a decent life. If the market is slow and the ordered workers cannot earn enough, they can look for other job opportunities. In a weak period, fixed wages can be more efficient to prevent employees from leaving for other occasions.”

Variable wages can lead to unhealthy competition among employees. They become less willing to help each other. Team cooperation can be affected negatively. In the long term, relationships between colleagues can become bitter. While, in fixed pay schemes, employees are able to maintain cordial relationships in the office.”

“Most times, sales jobs have a variable component. This could have a negative impact on the employee’s attitude towards customers. They can force customers irrationally just to make profits for themselves. They could overestimate the price for customers just to make more profit. While a fixed wage employee would maintain healthy and positive relationships with customers, which would allow him to find the right balance in his approach.”
